title: Businesses exploit a loophole allowing them to keep using plastic bags despite new hard-line laws
text:
Victorian businesses are exploiting a loophole so they can continue to give out single use plastic bags despite incoming bans and legislation.

The Andrews Government's plastic bag ban will be enforced from November 1, with retailers ordered to stop handing out light weight bags in an effort to reduce plastic pollution.

Businesses can be fined up to $49,500 under the new laws - but some businesses have become exempt from strict conditions due to previously ordered stock in a grace period.

Retailers such as Bakers Delight have received provisions to continue to give out plastic bags for months after the ban, after placing a bulk order of 1.6million reusable 35-micron bags before the bag ban was introduced in May last year.

Bakers Delight (pictured) have been granted provisions to continue to give out plastic bans after the Victorian governments plastic bag ban has been implemented

Victorians currently use up to one billion single-use plastic bags (pictured) per year

Lightweight bags like these will be illegal under the new legislation, but the business was given permission to use them by the Environment Protection Authority instead of the alternative option of sending them to landfill.

The National Retailers Association has met with various businesses over the past six months to help with the transition away from plastic bags, sparking fears that many retailers aren't prepared for the new changes.

The NRA Vic Bag Ban website states 'if you are left with unused stock at the ban deadline, you cannot provide these to customers.'

Australian Retailers Association executive director Russell Zimmerman told the Herald Sun these conditions could set a precedent for other businesses to apply for their own exemptions from the new laws.

'We’re very worried about how this is going to be handled by the Victorian government,' Mr Zimmerman said.

'They will need to give some leniency. If they come down strong and heavy, it’s going to create some backlash.'
description: Victorian businesses are exploiting a loophole so they can continue to give out single use plastic bags despite incoming bans and legislation.
authors: Jackson Barron For Daily Mail Australia
